name: SalesOrderBasic_GetByorderNbr
description: Data for a single Sales Order Basic

erp-api-background.description: If a URL value is provided, then API endpoint will be queued and executed in background. When the execution of the background operation is finished, the system will POST the response to the specified URL. The endpoint itself responds in this case with a 202-Accepted status and a reference to a state document for the background operation.

$block: This class represents a SOOrder in SOOrderController. Used by getting data.

$ul: **attachments**: The data containing information about the document attachments
**branchNumber**: Mandatory field: Document details tab > Branch* > The branch of the company.
**name**: Click the magnifier. > The name.
**number**: Click the magnifier. > The identifier.
**contactId**: The top part > Contact > The contact person of the customer.
**currency**: The top part > Currency > The currency of the document.
**customer**: The top part > Customer > The customer that has ordered the goods or services.
**internalId**
**name**: The name of the particular destination of the selected type.
**number**: The identifier of the particular destination of the selected type.
**customerOrder**: The top part > Customer order > The reference number of the original customer document that the sales order is based on.

**customerRefNo**: The top part > External reference > The reference number of the sales order in a third-party application if Visma.net Financials is integrated with such an application and imports the sales orders from it.
**date**: Mandatory field: The top part > Date* >  The date of the document.
**description**: The top part > Description > A brief description of the document.
**discountTotal**
**discountTotalInBaseCurrency**
**errorInfo**
**exchangeRate**
**hold**: The top part > Hold > A check box that you select if the document is on hold and should not be processed further at this time.
**lastModifiedDateTime**: Background information collected from the system.
**lines**

**location**: Mandatory field: The top part > Location* > The customer location from which the goods or services have been ordered or, if the sales order is created from an opportunity, the customer location specified for the opportunity.
**countryId**: Location*.
**id**: Click the magnifier > The identifier
**name**: Click the magnifier > The displayed name
**metadata**
**maxPageSize**
**totalCount**
**note**: Icon Notes on top of the window > Pop-up window for providing any user-defined text connected to the order.
**orderNo**: The top part > Order no.: > The reference number of the document.
**orderTotal**: The top part > Order total > The total amount of the document, which is calculated as follows:
**orderTotalInBaseCurrency**
**orderType**: Mandatory field: The top part > Order type > The type of the document, which is one of the predefined order types or a custom order type created by using the (SO201000) window.
**requestOn**: Mandatory field: The top part > Requested on > The date when the customer wants to receive the goods; this date provides the default values for the Requested on dates for order lines.

**status**: The top part > Status > The status of the document, which can be one of the following options: On hold, Credit hold, Pending aååroval, Rejected, Open, Cancelled, Shipping, Back order, Invoiced, Completed.
**taxTotal**: The top part > VAT total > The total amount of tax paid on the document.
**taxTotalInBaseCurrency**
**vatExemptTotal**: The top part > VAT exempt total > The document total that is exempt from VAT.
**vatExemptTotalInBaseCurrency**
**vatTaxableTotal**: The top part > VAT taxable total > The document total that is subject to VAT.
**vatTaxableTotalInBaseCurrency**
**stateLocation**
